info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Catawba, eastern Rutherford, northwestern Lincoln, western Cleveland, southeastern Burke, north central Spartanburg and northwestern Cherokee Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 715 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles south of Morganton to 11 miles north of Spartanburg. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Forest City, Boiling Springs NC, Chesnee, Belwood, Lawndale, Polkville, Ellenboro, Lattimore, Mooresboro and Bostic. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
